meanings.definition: The state of being subject to certain conditions or requirements.
meanings.sent1: The conditionality of the agreement required us to meet specific deadlines.
meanings.sent2: The job offer came with the conditionality of passing a background check.
meanings.sent3: The conditionality of getting dessert was finishing all your vegetables.
meanings.sent4: Her love was filled with conditionality, always dependent on his actions.
meanings.sent5: The conditionality of winning the race was crossing the finish line first.

meanings.definition: The quality of being contingent on something else.
meanings.sent1: The success of the project had a strong conditionality on teamwork.
meanings.sent2: The price of the house had a conditionality on the current market value.
meanings.sent3: His mood seemed to have a conditionality on the weather outside.
meanings.sent4: The growth of the plant had a conditionality on the amount of sunlight it received.
meanings.sent5: The conditionality of her forgiveness depended on his sincere apology.
